# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in split(text, " ")
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            wrapped_text += word
        else
            wrapped_text += word
        end
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a long sentence that needs to be wrapped due to its excessive length. Keep going."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes a text string and a maximum width for wrapping. It iterates over each word in the text, wrapping the line when it exceeds the specified width. The final wrapped text is returned.
